channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.dc:creator: Nathan Hondros
item.description: Premier Mark McGowan has insisted WA's coronavirus contact tracing system is match fit after Prime Minister Scott Morrison questioned the state's preparedness.
item.title: 'WA a victim of its own success': McGowan sidesteps PM's contact tracing criticism

item.description: The accomplished swordswoman sacrificed a beckoning music career when World War II began.
item.title: 'Woman of her time' mixed in diplomatic and charity circles

item.dc:creator: Marissa Calligeros
item.description: Victoria's daily COVID-19 figures appear to be firmly in the double digits after the state recorded 55 new cases on Tuesday. NSW experts are investigating whether a COVID-19 hospital cluster could have spread through contact with computer screens, pens or paper.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: Victoria records 55 COVID-19 cases as state's contact tracing flagged for revamp; Sydney hospital cluster grows as Australian death toll jumps to 770

item.dc:creator: Adam Cooper
item.description: News outlets being sued by Ben Roberts-Smith over allegations he was involved in unlawful killings are likely to be granted access to confidential documents.
item.title: Media could get access Ben Roberts-Smith documents in defamation case

item.dc:creator: Jocelyn Garcia
item.description: The men accused of killing Andrew Wright Stephens have appeared in court via video link.
item.title: Body of Brisbane man found five days after alleged murder: Police

item.dc:creator: Paul Sakkal
item.description: Two positive COVID-19 cases at the studio of Craig Hutchison's Crocmedia have put the immediate future of a swath of radio and television programs in doubt.
item.title: SEN radio outbreak sends football identities into isolation

item.dc:creator: Peter Ryan
item.description: Snapshot is a weekly column that takes a lighter look at the world of football.
item.title: Snapshot: The funny man getting former Magpie Swan through lockdown

item.dc:creator: Hamish Hastie
item.description: Clean State's plan includes massive increases in bike infrastructure, a locally-built trackless tram network and pivoting WA's diesel bus manufacturing facility in Malaga into an electric bus maker.
item.title: Bikes on Perth's peak-hour trains and 2000km of cycle path to make COVID-19 stimulus greener

item.description: The best photos from the international wire agencies as chosen by our picture editors
item.title: Gallery: The best photos from around the world

item.dc:creator: Eryk Bagshaw
item.description: The film has been criticised for working on the $274 million action epic with the Chinese security bureau responsible for detaining Uighurs.
item.title: 'It just keeps getting worse': Disney epic Mulan under fire over human rights

item.description: Joanna Braithwaite uses humour and animals effectively in her paintings to pose questions about science, politics, and human nature.
item.title: Flights of fancy invite contemplation

item.dc:creator: Heather McNeill
item.description: A Fremantle bar manager has become one of the first people in WA to be charged over racist comments he allegedly made online.
item.title: 'Cloak of anonymity no longer an excuse': Fremantle man fronts court over racist online posts

item.description: Victoria records 41 new cases and nine deaths as road plan comes under fire; Three more hospital workers test positive in Sydney; NSW Premier confirms year 12 formals and graduations can go ahead. News updates here.
item.title: Tablet interactive: Coronavirus outbreak

item.dc:creator: Gary Adshead
item.description: A man labelled a “risk to security” by Australia’s internal spy agency will be flown from coronavirus-crippled Melbourne to a detention centre in WA to keep him safe from the pandemic.
item.title: 'Security risk' detainee to be flown from Melbourne to WA detention centre

item.dc:creator: Alexandra Smith
item.description: NSW Premier Gladys Berejiklian will not agree to the Nationals' demands for an urgent cabinet meeting to debate koala planning policy.
item.title: Berejiklian stands her ground against Nationals' demands

item.dc:creator: Adrian Proszenko
item.description: The Wests Tigers believe Josh Addo-Carr could become the long-term fullback they have been searching for since the departure of James Tedesco.
item.title: Tigers table four-year, multi-million-dollar deal for Addo-Carr

item.dc:creator: Georgina Mitchell
item.description: Fiona Barbieri and her son lashed out at police who entered their home to arrest him in December 2012.
item.title: Barbieri granted parole over manslaughter of NSW Police officer

item.dc:creator: Kate Hedley
item.description: Before Nicola's release from prison there was no women's program at Shalom. If she hadn't refused to take "no" for an answer, there may never have been one.
item.title: 'There is absolutely hope': WA's Shalom House extends drug rehab program to women

item.dc:creator: Toby Crockford
item.description: Member for Oodgeroo Mark Robinson, whose electorate includes Redland City and North Stradbroke Island, has referred it to police.
item.title: Queensland MP receives 'violent threat' for backing financial irregularities inquiry

item.dc:creator: Matt Dennien
item.description: Southbound lanes of the William Jolly Bridge are expected to remain closed into Tuesday afternoon after the incident on Skew Street.
item.title: Motorcyclist killed after falling under bus in inner Brisbane

item.description: Two survivors were rescued before a second typhoon halted the search at the weekend.
item.title: Coast guard resumes search for missing cattle ship crew off Japan

item.description: Professor Martin Tattersall played a pioneering role in enhancing communication and shared decision-making between doctors and patients.
item.title: The father of Australian medical oncology

item.description: Actor Simon Maiden was starring in Come From Away, which opened a year ago in Melbourne... and then closed. Now he's getting by on JobKeeper and royalty cheques.
item.title: Beyond yelling at clouds, Maiden waits for rebirth of theatre

item.dc:creator: Greg Baum
item.description: The broadcaster's threat to abandon the Big Bash League because of a lack of quality is empty.
item.title: Seven swings and misses on Big Bash League

item.dc:creator: Damien Ractliffe
item.description: A behavioural scientist asked by police to analyse footage of four Darren Weir-trained horses being 'jiggered' while running on a treadmill believes the horses showed no signs of fear.
item.title: 'Jiggered' horses showed no fear, scientist tells hearing

item.description: Two new studies of elite athletes found that working out amplifies the immune response to a flu shot.
item.title: Exercise may boost your vaccine response

item.dc:creator: Jacqueline Maley
item.description: On July 5 2018, John Edwards gunned down his two children after stalking them at the rental home they had fled to with their mother, Olga.
item.title: Jack kept a cricket bat in his room to defend himself from his father

item.description: One man is dead and another is assisting police with their inquiries as a homicide investigation unfolds in Perth's north.
item.title: Dog at the centre of police probe in Perth's north

item.description: The nuclear-armed rivals have been engaged in a tense standoff in the cold-desert Ladakh region since May.
item.title: China says Indian forces crossed border, fired warning shots

item.description: Salvador Dali's design for the famous Chupa Chup logo shows the surrealist master had "an advertising head", says a contributor to a new NGV art education course.
item.title: That's surreal: an ad man running an art course

item.description: The Australian young gun tamed Canada's Vasek Pospisil in straight sets and now has an appointment with world No.3 Dominic Thiem.
item.title: Alex de Minaur surges into US Open quarter-final with straight-sets win

item.dc:creator: Rachel Clun
item.description: Two more COVID-19 cases in healthcare workers have been linked to the Concord and Liverpool hospitals cluster.
item.title: Boarding school in Sydney's east shuts as hospital outbreaks grow

item.dc:creator: Scott Spits
item.description: Novak Djokovic has urged his supporters to leave a US Open lineswoman alone after she became the target of their abuse following the world No.1's default in New York.
item.title: 'She’s done nothing wrong at all': Djokovic's support for official after online abuse

item.dc:creator: Megan Gorrey
item.description: The proposed rate factors in the cost of local government elections across NSW next September.
item.title: Council levies to jump 2 per cent for most NSW ratepayers

item.dc:creator: Dominic Powell
item.description: Supermarket giant Woolworths has reshuffled its senior management team to highlight the importance of the retailer's broad 'ecosystem' strategy.
item.title: Woolworths shuffles its leadership as it looks beyond supermarkets

item.description: In a statement on Facebook, the police said the girl was running in a "suspicious manner" that required officers to chase and subdue her.
item.title: Outcry after Hong Kong riot police tackles 12-year-old to the ground

item.dc:creator: Stephen Bartholomeusz
item.description: The prospect that Trump might actually follow through with his threat to decouple from China if he is re-elected ought to send shivers through corporate America and their western peers.
item.title: Self-inflicted wound: Trump would severely damage the US if he carries out his China threat

item.dc:creator: Broede Carmody
item.description: The breakfast presenter breached standards of decency with last year's on-air comments and has been counselled by management.
item.title: Kyle Sandilands 'overstepped the mark' with Virgin Mary comments, says watchdog

item.dc:creator: Noel Towell
item.description: Police were worried about security at hotels as early as mid-April, an inquiry has heard.
item.title: Police concerned about travellers wandering in and out of hotels, inquiry told

item.dc:creator: Anthony Galloway
item.description: A coalition of scientists and security experts are pushing for a global agreement to protect the moon and outer space from militarisation as the United States forges ahead with its plan to mine the lunar surface.
item.title: Pyne joins global push to save outer space from exploitation

item.dc:creator: Latika Bourke
item.description: AstraZeneca, a British company, has already begun producing some of the 30 million doses the British government has on order.
item.title: 'We're ahead': British health secretary vows vaccine before Australia

item.description: In China, an even scarier bubble than Big Tech is on the horizon. It's engineered not by the nation's notorious mum-and-dad investors, but professional stock pickers.
item.title: A bubble is brewing on China's sharemarket

item.dc:creator: Jocelyn Garcia
item.description: The high hopes of the cinema being back in full swing to attract people to the area has been shortlived.
item.title: Not even Nolan blockbuster could save Brisbane high street from virus

item.dc:creator: Tony Moore
item.description: Questions are emerging about an announcement by Tourism Minister Kate Jones that by Christmas tourists could ride a river ferry to Straddie in 40 minutes.
item.title: 40 minutes to Straddie? Not so fast, minister

item.dc:creator: Lydia Lynch
item.description: The first two hours of the final sitting day of Queensland Parliament ahead of the October 31 election was dominated by borders and the economy.
item.title: Queensland ramps up 'strong border' lines as jobs, economy tumble

item.description: Coronavirus assessment centres have been established across Queensland.
item.title: Where to get tested for coronavirus in Queensland

item.dc:creator: Heather McNeill
item.description: The emergency drill was carried out on a hot December afternoon with some of the toddlers having just woken from a nap.
item.title: Perth childcare centre fined $15,000 after toddlers' feet burnt during fire drill

item.description: Over his life, Fabian Marsden was on dialysis for a total of 12 years and had about 50 surgeries.
item.title: Years on kidney dialysis didn't hinder civic service

item.dc:creator: Jocelyn Garcia
item.description: Two Queensland police officers charged with possessing and supplying dangerous drugs have been suspended and will front court in October.
item.title: Two Queensland police officers charged with supplying drugs

item.dc:creator: Rachel Eddie
item.description: The Wyndham council area on Melbourne's south-western fringe has topped the list for active cases of coronavirus for much of the pandemic.
item.title: Tough times in hard-hit Werribee with people 'at end of their tether'
